  • havoc.autoval.tests.replay_sol_buffer.replay_sol_buffer

Source code for havoc.autoval.tests.replay_sol_buffer.replay_sol_buffer

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
import time
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_base import TestBase
from havoc.autoval.lib.test_utils.screenwithsol import ScreenWithSOL

SOL_BUFFER_SIZE = 16384  # SOL buffer size for Leopard is 16KB (16384 bytes).
SOL_NO_ACTVTY_TIME = 60  # Seconds


[docs]class ReplaySOLBuffer(TestBase):


[docs]    def execute(self):
        self.log_info("This is the Replay SOL Buffer test.")
        sws = ScreenWithSOL(self.host)
        sws.setup_cleanup()
        screenlog = sws.start_SOL_on_logged_screen_session()

        buffer_junk = self.fill_SOL_buffer()
        self.wait_for_SOL_no_activity(screenlog)

        # The SOL replay is functioning properly if the amount of output
        # it produces during a replay is equal to the SOL's buffer size.
        # Sometimes more output than the buffer size occurs. I believe this
        # is because the system is normally just logging events to the SOL
        # on a regular basis. This is okay.
        num_chars_start = self.get_num_chars(screenlog)

        self.host.oob.replay_sol_buffer()
        self.wait_for_SOL_no_activity(screenlog)

        num_chars_end = self.get_num_chars(screenlog)

        junk_found = False
        with open(screenlog, "r") as screen_log:
            for line in screen_log:
                if buffer_junk in line:
                    # If just one of the two lines of buffer junk exists,
                    # that's good enough.
                    junk_found = True

        self.validate_condition(junk_found,
                                "Expected output is in the SOL buffer.")

        sws.setup_cleanup()

        num_chars_diff = int(num_chars_end) - int(num_chars_start)
        self.validate_condition(num_chars_diff >= SOL_BUFFER_SIZE,
                        ("SOL replay produced %d characters/bytes of output. " +
                        "Expected >= %d.") % (num_chars_diff, SOL_BUFFER_SIZE))



[docs]    def fill_SOL_buffer(self):
        buffer_junk = "A" * int(SOL_BUFFER_SIZE / 2)  # trash to fill buff with
        SOL_console = "/dev/ttyS1"
        self.host.run("echo '%s' > %s" % (buffer_junk, SOL_console))
        self.host.run("echo '%s' > %s" % (buffer_junk, SOL_console))
        return buffer_junk



[docs]    def wait_for_SOL_no_activity(self, screenlog):
        self.log_info("Blocking until no new output is displayed on SOL " +
                      "for %d consecutive seconds..." % (SOL_NO_ACTVTY_TIME))
        prev_num_chars = self.get_num_chars(screenlog)
        end_time = time.time() + SOL_NO_ACTVTY_TIME

        while time.time() < end_time:
            cur_num_chars = self.get_num_chars(screenlog)

            if cur_num_chars != prev_num_chars:
                end_time = time.time() + SOL_NO_ACTVTY_TIME

            prev_num_chars = cur_num_chars

            time.sleep(1)  # No need to check every microsecond...



[docs]    def get_num_chars(self, filename):
        wc_output = self.host.localhost.run("wc -c %s" % (filename))
        num_chars = wc_output.split()[0]
        return int(num_chars)



[docs]def main():
    test = ReplaySOLBuffer()
    test.lifecycle()


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
